DOC.brief_summary: Patients undergoing multivessel off-pump coronary bypass surgery ( OPCAB ) inevitably experience cumulative ischemia-reperfusion injury myocardium . Glucose-insulin-potassium ( GIK ) potentially useful adjunct myocardial protection . This study design evaluate effect GIK infusion myocardium patient undergoing OPCAB . Patients undergo OPCAB acute coronary syndrome randomly assign GIK Control group . The trial double-blind conduct single center .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Glucose-insulin-potassium Solution Myocardial Protection During Off-pump Coronary Bypass Surgery Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Patients undergo isolated OPCAB . Age : 20~75 . Emergency operation . Patients MR ≥ 2 . Patients IDDM . Patients random sugar ≥ 250 mg/dL . Patients serum creatinine ≥ 2.0 mg/dL . Patients acute myocardial infarction within 1 week surgery
